user_review: LOVE! The service is great, the food is delicious and the drinks are to die for! Love love love! We got the bacon and sausage cheese boat as well as the poutine - both were great! My boyfriend and I ate half of our dishes and then swapped so that we could enjoy both. Best decision ever! The drinks were made very well and were a lot more chic than I anticipated they would be. My favorite was the Moscow mule - they let you pour the ginger beer yourself so you can make it as spicy as you want! We also got the Knight of St. Nevski, which had Russian soda and tasted like banana. The Sunset cocktail was grapefruity and was garnished with a little rose bud - cute!Oh and their donuts are Y U M.

I experienced Nevski shortly after visiting Georgia (the country) and what a disappointment it was. Georgian food is amazing, incredible, mind-blowing - Nevski's food is uninspired and heated in the microwave. The Khachapuri is bland and not much more than a mozzarella pizza. The dumpling or equivalent to Khinkalis are basically stuffed pastas you could've bought at Costco. Staff was nice, but I can't figure out why you have to order at the bar? Anyway. Won't go back.
Nevesky is authentic ex-soviet food in a modern and hipster decor/ambiance. A bit of a small/limited menu but totally worth it

I stopped in for lunch, and it was really great. The dumplings were hearty, without being overly dense, and the summer sunset cocktail was incredible. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Montreal.
